description:
Hi guys!

Thank you all of you for joining this group and hope we will have many sportive activities together outdoors!

As it seems that the weather will be lovely this weekend, I thought to invite you for a light exercise in the park on Saturday morning (a fresh way to start the weekend).

We will be running for approximately 15 min, just to warm up and do several exercises in the park afterwards (no equipment needed).

Hope to see you there on Saturday!

Raluca and George
name: Exercise in the Cinquantenaire park (for beginners)

description:
The Hautes Fagnes make up the largest nature reserve in Belgium, with an area of 4,501.2 hectares (11,123 acres). They are part of the 700km2 Hohes Venn-Eifel park which spans the Belgian-German border.


We would meet at 7:40 am in the Gare Centrale of Brussels (at the tickets desk) to  grab the 08:01 am train to Eupen. The train trip will take about 2 hours . After we arrive in Eupen we would have to walk for about 4km (or we can take a taxi) to get to the Eupen Lake, where the trail will begin. We can walk through the park for about 2 hours than stop somewhere for a picnic and play some games. Depending on how tired we will be, we can walk for 2 hours more and then come back to Eupen. At 18:15 we will catch the train, to be in Brussels by 20:00.

Take with you:

- food for picnic and food for the road (there might be also a restaurant in the park, but I am not sure how deep into the forest it will be)

- small blanket for picnic

- good trekking shoes

-jacket for the rain(hoping we will not need it)

If any of you has already been there please share your experience!

Hope to see you there!

Raluca
how_to_find_us: Gare Centrale of Brussels (at the tickets desk)
name: Trekking Hautes Fagnes Nature Reserve
